subject: Philosophy
title: The Black Swan
description: A 60-second lesson on The Black Swan.

hook.text: For centuries Europeans believed all swans were white. Then they found black swans in Australia.

buildup.text: No matter how many white swans you've seen, it only takes one black swan to destroy the generalization.

discovery.text: Nassim Taleb used this to argue that rare, unpredictable events shape history more than normal ones.

twist.text: We build models based on what we've seen. But the most important events are often ones we never imagined.

climax.text: Financial crashes, pandemics, and revolutions are all black swans. Induction fails exactly when stakes are highest.

punchline.text: The unseen can shatter everything you thought you knew.

quiz.question: What does the 'black swan' concept illustrate?
options: A single counterexample can disprove a generalization
